location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘File 7/28 Payment of toll gate fees by R.A.F.’

physicalDescription.extent: The file’s contents are arranged in chronological order, from the earliest item at the front to the latest at the end. Circled index numbers written using blue/red crayon can also be found in throughout the file, and refer to the page of office notes at the end of the file (folio 4).

Foliation: The foliation sequence begins on the front cover and ends on the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, and can be found in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. The following foliation anomalies occur: 1, 1A, and 1B.

mods.abstract: The contents of the file relate to a proposal (folio 1B) made by the Political Agent at Bahrain (Edward Birkbeck Wakefield) to the Adviser to the Bahrain Government (Charles Dalrymple Belgrave) that a monthly fee be paid by the RAF to allow their vehicles to cross the Manama-Muharraq causeway, in place of the existing charges applied to each individual vehicle on crossing, which, the Agent says, causes unnecessary delays.
